e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it reflects the true financial performance of the company and eliminates legal risks associated with the current biased reporting. While there may be short-term challenges in investor perception, prioritizing honesty and transparency fosters long-term trust with investors and aligns with ethical standards.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and timeliness in financial disclosures. It should avoid biases that mislead investors while ensuring compliance with regulatory guidelines. Additionally, an ethical policy considers the impact of reported information on all stakeholders, promoting informed decision-making and maintaining trust in the financial markets.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the transition to the new policy to investors, ensuring they understand the change and its implications. Additionally, I would inquire about the potential strategies to mitigate any short-term stock price impact during the transition period and how to educate retail investors regarding the new reporting standards.
